Inference for return levels

Paul Northrop

2023-09-02

Source: vignettes/return-levels.Rmd
return-levels.Rmd

GEV

\(p = (1 - 1 / m) ^ {1 / n_y}\)

\(x_m = \mu + F^{-1}(0, \sigma, \xi)\), where \(F(\mu, \sigma, \xi)\) is the distribution function of a GEV(\(\mu, \sigma, \xi\)) distribution.

PP

Binomial GP

The value of the extremal index \(\theta\) matters. The exact expression for the \(m\)-year return level is

\[x_m = u+\frac{\sigma_u}{\xi} \left[ p_u^\xi \left\{ 1-\left( 1-\displaystyle \frac1m\right)^{1/n_y\theta} \right\}^{-\xi} - 1 \right].\]

If \(m n_y \theta\) is large then

\[x_m \approx u+\frac{\sigma_u}{\xi} \left[ (mn_y\theta p_u)^\xi - 1 \right].\]

References
